title: Implement Version Controlled Approach to Tracking Context Externally
summary: Implement a version controlled approach for tracking context externally, enabling systematic versioning, change tracking, and rollback capabilities for the memory-bank context system.

success_criteria.text: Context files are version controlled with semantic versioning
Change history is tracked and accessible for all context updates
Rollback mechanisms allow reverting to previous context versions
Context dependencies and relationships are tracked across versions
Automated version bumping based on context change types

acceptance_checks.text: Context files include version metadata and change logs
Git integration provides version history and branching for context
Context validation ensures version consistency across the system
Rollback commands can restore previous context states
Context versioning follows semantic versioning principles

subtasks: Design version control schema for context files
Integrate with Git for distributed version control
Add context validation and consistency checks
Create CLI tools for context version management
Document version control workflows and best practices

decisions: Version control will follow semantic versioning principles (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH)
Context files will include version metadata in YAML frontmatter
Git will be used as the primary version control system for context tracking
Automated version bumping will be based on context change types and impact
